II. PROPOSED HYBRID BOOST CONVERTER
The proposed hybrid boost converter consists of nine
power switches (ğ‘†1~ğ‘†9), three flying capacitors (ğ¶ğ¹1~ğ¶ğ¹3),
one inductor (ğ¿), and an output capacitor (ğ¶ğ‘‚), shown in Fig.
2. ğ‘‰ ğ¼ğ‘ and ğ‘‰ ğ‘‚ are the input and output voltage respectively;
ğ‘‰ ğ¶ğ¹1, ğ‘‰ ğ¶ğ¹2 and ğ‘‰ ğ¶ğ¹3 are the voltage across ğ¶ğ¹1, ğ¶ğ¹2 and ğ¶ğ¹3;
ğ‘…ğ‘‚ is the load resistor. The proposed converter is configured
with three modes of operation: light boost mode, medium
boost mode and deep boost mode. Their operations will be
introduced in the following sub-sections.

A. Light Boost Mode
The steady-state operation principle in the light boost
mode is depicted in Fig. 3(a). In the light boost mode, ğ‘†5 and
ğ‘†6 are always ON while ğ‘†7 is always OFF. Under this premise,
in state I (ğ›·1), ğ‘†1, ğ‘†3, ğ‘†4 and ğ‘†9 are turned on, while ğ‘†2 and
ğ‘†8 are turned off. ğ¶ğ¹1 is charged up to ğ‘‰ ğ¼ğ‘. Meanwhile, both
